user_review: (Visited 12/11/2019.) Heading home for the weekend and I needed a lunch before my flight so I stopped here! It had incredible reviews so how could I skip past this place? Here's how it went.Atmosphere/Appearance: So right downtown is this gem. It has such a presence about it, it's incredible. So once inside you're enveloped with such modern, yet retro diner feel. It's truly unique. Bright neon/LED lights, diner stools, stainless steel everywhere, it was just so cool. It was lunch time so it wasn't too busy, but I can totally see this place being packed on a good weekend night!Service: Luduina took care of me and she was excellent. She was clearly experienced, charismatic, sweet and took care of everything that I needed.Food: For my lunch I went with their Cambalache Salad. This salad consists of grilled flat iron steak with red chimichurri sauce atop mixed greens, black beans, corn kernels, hearts of palm, red peppers, yellow peppers, red onions, avocado and mangos all tossed in a light mango dressing. It was fantastic. The salty and savory worked so well with the sweetness. It felt healthy, wasn't heavy and just was straight delicious.Value: (All prices in $CAD.) My salad was $27.00 and I think that was a bit much for a freaking salad, but it had steak on it so that's likely where the cost came from. No worries, it was worth it.In conclusion, I really enjoyed this place and wish I had known about it much earlier in my Montréal visits. Their food AND drink menu is extensive and intriguing! Check this place out if you're around!

This place is so fun and upscale! The vibe is a 50s theme and the decor is sooo cute! As tourists, my husband and I obviously ordered the poutine and let me just say, BOMB.COM!!!!! I haven't experienced poutine much but this place makes it soo good I really don't care to try other places! My husband and I quickly devoured that. For our entrees I got the Kentucky country fried steak  dish & he got a pasta dish! Again they were both so yummy. The drinks were flavorful too and had cool names. I do recommend sharing dishes because they do give large portions but overall the food is veryyy tasty here. Parking was a little difficult, we did have to pay for parking in a lot  but there is parking on the streets if you're lucky to get a spot. Service was great tooo! Our waiter gave us great drink recommendations & also food recommendations which I thought was very nice especially since we are not from there! 10/10 food 10/10 drinks 10/10 ambience

If you're looking for a large sized lunch. This is the place to visit! The wall decor inside gives off an old school vibe which I loved.My friends loved it. I on the other hand deduct one star - 1. Because it was a struggle to eat such a large sandwich. It was super messy and I was getting a little frustrated being that I was hungry 2. It was kinda dry. Wish it had more sauce. Fries were amazing. Staff was very polite as well Overall the meal was well prepared and the wait time was very brief.

Came here on our last night In Montreal for dinner. It sure was a happening place! It was extremely busy and I like the 50s Diner vibe through-out the place. The menus and booths are cute and the servers were extremely friendly and nice for most of it.I ordered the Mac N Cheese Wontons as they seemed to be a hit within my fellow yelpers reviews. However, I found it to be very bland and barely finished one due to the lack of flavor. Maybe it was an off night for the kitchen? The server even mentioned it was odd as it's their best seller. Just wasn't for me and I didn't see anything else on the menu that really tickled my fancy. I mean, there are good things on the menu but then some random ingredient would be added that would throw off the dish in my opinion (See the fried . My husband however, enjoyed his mussels and it was a heaping portion! He said they were delicious and would order them again!

I went there before a habs game at the Bell Center. I definitely recommend if you can't find a place to eat before the game, cause all the restaurants close to the Bell Center are really packed before the games, so you really need to reserve...your best bet would be Deville Dinerbar!Good, filling and fast service.I think I've been ordering the Ahi tuna tacos since they opened..and of course that's what I ordered! This is consistently good, every single time.The tacos are fried and crispy, and the filling is fresh. The sauce is on the side, so depending how good you are at eating this and keeping the tacos whole..you will either spread, dip or ..end up eating this with a fork and knife. This might not be the best choice for a first date or business meal..but it's definitely in my opinion, a must try!They also have specials on specific drinks, depending on the night.

My husband and I had lunch at Deville Dinebar and overall the food was good, but I found it a bit pricey for what it was. I had the Deville Macho Salad ($23) and my husband had the Korean Fried Chicken Sandwich with fries ($20). I asked for no corn kernels in my salad and for the salad dressing to be on the side. My salad came as requested. However, for some reason my salad was missing the sliced almonds that was listed on the menu. Anyway, so my salad had mixed greens (iceberg, romaine, radicchio, and spinach), rotisserie chicken, grape tomatoes, goat cheese, avocado, dates and cornbread croutons. The dressing was a champagne vinaigrette. I liked that the chicken was lean breast meat. It still had the skin on, but no big deal, I just peeled it off and didn't eat it. The croutons were really unique. The cornbread was really sweet and had almost a caramelized flavour to it. The crunchy texture and the sweetness actually went well with the rest of the salad. They were generous with the goat cheese. I was a bit disappointed to see iceberg in a $23 salad. I was expecting tastier greens, like kale or arugula, but at least it had spinach and radicchio.My husband enjoyed his Korean Fried Chicken Sandwich. He said the meat was a combination of dark and white meat. He said the Kimchi was really mild, so don't shy away from it if you don't like pungent Kimchi. The fries were shoestring fries which are my absolute favourite. I was lucky enough to be able to snag a few and they were fantastic. Service was friendly and efficient. Our server, Cameron, refilled our waters when he noticed they were low and he checked up on us appropriately. They also give you lots of ice with your water, which I love. Our food came out relatively quick.Decor I would describe as diner-like with a lounge-like feel, if that makes sense, lol. The place is fairly large. Unless you are just having an appetizer, you cannot get a meal for less than $20. Sandwiches and salads are the least expensive items and they start at $20. Mains are in the $30-50 range. The food was good, but like I said, I personally found it pricey for what it was.

As many have probably said in other reviews, the prices are a bit higher than expected, but once the food arrives it seems like a fair deal.Deville is quite a large space and the design is if you mixed upscale and kitschy diner. I ended up ordering the Korean fried chicken burger. One reason I did is I believe the price was closest to what I thought a comparable restaurant would charge (somewhere around $20), but also because it looked good. Once it arrived, the presentation looked great and it appeared very appetizing. The sandwich is huge too. Once I bit in, it was clear the chicken was fresh and made in house. I was also surprised that they seemed to go quite legit with the kimchi. It had all the pungency and heat you'd expect from real kimchi rather than a watered-down version at a hipster restaurant. The side salad was needed on my behalf as I had eaten virtually nothing but carbs the 48 hours leading up to it. The salad was made with very deep greens and was extremely fresh. Aside from the latent health benefits of it (and it wasn't over-dressed), it seemed to give me a placebo affect of some type of cleanse by body needed. Yes, I'm aware of how inconsistent that is with my choice of burger.My friend ordered the wonton ahi tuna tacos. I can review since I had an entire one (the order comes with three). As with the theme, the price seemed a little steep, but once you see the three large tacos - and more importantly: taste the quality of the tuna, it turns out to be fair enough. I honestly loved them, and the taste and freshness of them was superb. The only problem with them was they can get a bit messy since they're stuffed and also since the wonton taco starts to break apart easily. On the flip side, I still don't think they have to change as the wonton taste and texture is so perfectly matched to the dish. That initial bite of the crisp wonton, the soft, warm tuna and the freshness of crisp veggies still sticks out in my mind.I'd heartily recommend this place. If 'dinebar' elicits 'diner' or specifically diner prices, you need to do away with that notion. Virtually everything on the menu - appies included - starts near $20 and then goes north from there. But once you see the portions and taste the quality, it's par for the course and worth trying for sure.

We were a large group of 12 and it was very nice of the restaurant to be able to accommodate with us in a short notice. The decor was stunning and had amazing lighting. I personally ordered a bbq chicken tacos and it surprised me that it ended up being a lettuce wrap. I think the flavouring of the food was good but nothing too special. The chicken was kinda spicy as well which was unexpecting. Another friend also ordered the Mac and cheese lasagna and according to him, he said it was very good and filling. Overall though, the food was a little bit pricey but the portions were big at least. I've been told that the desserts are a go to so next time I'm in Montreal, I will definitely go back to try that.

I came here with a few friends on a Sunday night.The decor is very fun and original. The vibe is really fun, almost making us forget that the weekend was almost over.We were seated in a comfy booth and looked over the menu. They have so many options, all which looked delish. All the comfort food you could ever want.We shared an order of the mac and cheese wontons which were served in a cute take-out box with their logo on it. They were good, though possibly a bit underwhelming.Then I shared the Ahi Tuna salad with my friend. It was a huge portion and was very good. All fresh ingredients and nice presentation.For dessert, we all shared the Pain perdu (basically french toast and ice cream). It was super sweet so I wouldn't order it if that's not your thing. Thankfully for me, I love sweet desserts!The prices are a bit expensive but it makes sense for the location (right downtown). They do have a lunch menu which could be good for a work lunch. The service was pretty good when I was there but the restaurant also wasn't so busy.

This is a classic and fun American style upscale dining without the posh pretentious vibe. The decor is fun and they make fun drinks and have drinks specials for each night of the week (though I find them a bit sweet). Would recommend this place for a fun "college girl's night". Food and service are both good. It's not somewhere I'd return in a heart beat but I've been a few times and they were all favourable experiences. A little pricy for the value  in my personal opinion. Would give it a 3.5 stars if I could do half stars!

I've been to Deville twice and I've always felt like I was welcomed there. The décor is absolutely stunning, reminds you of a real diner, like the ones you see in movies and TV shows with an extraordinary pink theme. Their seating area isn't huge so make sure you call to reserve before showing up announced. The clientèle is mostly high-class people, but I've shown up once after school wearing a hoodie and leggings and they'll still welcome you. The only thing that's a bit disappointing is how loud it gets especially during the evening because the tables are very close to each other. Their drinking menu is also very versatile, they have a lot of cool options and diverse ones, also mixes that you've never tried before! The drink is very rich in alcohol and the taste is just phenomenal.I've had the chance to try their Philly Cheesesteak Rolls as an appetizer and let me tell you, they are DELICIOUS, definitely worth it. Very cheesy and rich in meat.Their salads aren't like any salad; they're huge! My friend and I split a General Tao salad and the Cambalache salad. They are both very filling, huge portions and delicious, very generous in meat.The staff is friendly, very knowledgeable and also very patient. The food is prepared pretty quickly.I would recommend this place if you're celebrating your birthday, if you're going out on a date or even with a friend!

Great food, great service and nice ambience. Their meatloaf is amazing. It's wrapped in bacon and comes with a delicious sauce and some mashed potato and veggies. All the appetizers I've tried such as the ahi tuna tacos or the calamari are delicious. The food is slightly towards the expensive side, but it comes in a great portion. The service is always great here. Our waitress tonight was so friendly and made us great suggestions for drinks. The place has a terrace towards the inside and it's great to eat there since you're not next to the road and cars.
Love this place!! Every time I'm in Montreal it is a staple. The service is always amazing and the food is superb!

Stopped in for a quick bite and some drinks.  Menu looks great, grabbed a few apps and drinks.  Btw if you need a good drink the bourbon lemonade is great and very boozy.  Diner food with a unique twist will for sure come back for a main course.  Inside very well decorated old style leather booths and stools great art and tv as well, would recommend just stopping in for a drink if your in the area and are looking for a good spot.

I've always enjoyed the food and the experience at Deville, but I cannot say that there is any one dish that really sets them apart from other restaurants. Sure, their burgers are tasty enough, but for the most part fall into the category of "messy kitchen sink" burgers in which there are mountains of overly complex toppings like root beer or bone marrow mayo, pork belly, and short rib. Ultimately, the burger is overwhelmed by the toppings and add ons, to the point where the beef takes a back seat.  I'm not saying the burgers aren't tasty, because they absolutely are. I just prefer a burger where I can choose my own cook on the beef and really taste it. What more, the burgers are moderately overpriced, even taking into account the rent in the downtown core. The other night, we started with the lobster roll appetizer. You are essentially getting 3 mini lobster rolls with the equivalent amount of meat found in 1 normally sized roll. They were quite tasty, but I cannot say the lobster salad mixture was bursting with fresh ocean flavour (not that I really expect as much on a frigid Saturday sitting in a restaurant on the dreary and lifeless Stanley street). I will say that it is clear that they shelled the lobster themselves because I almost ripped a filling out biting on a shell (see picture below). SO......Good for you for actually cooking and shelling a lobster in your kitchen. Shame on you for leaving pieces of the shell in it. Finally, at $23.50, they are charging about 5 dollars too much for this dish. At that price, there should be 4 mini rolls so that the dish can be shared equally.My wife had the ahi tuna salad which I tasted. The fish was fresh, and the portion of greens is very large. The dressing is unremarkable and could use a little acidity to brighten things up. For dessert, we tried the Oreo cookie ice cream sandwich. I forget the price, but I can say that it tastes identical to the type of Oreo ice cream sandwich you find in a depanneur freezer. Nothing wrong with that if you are not opposed to mind numbing boredom and mediocrity. Next time, I'll get the apple pie or banana cream pie dessert provided that my dining companion heeds my advice.Deville is always enjoyable, but seldom memorable. They actually have quite a large menu full of pasta dishes, steaks, and sandwiches. Their prices are too high in my humble opinion, and I feel that if I'm going to spend between 50-80$ on dinner before alcohol, I will want to go to a fancier place that specializes in something. The vibe here is just a little too casual for me to want to drop 200$ plus on dinner. I can go to Liverpool house, I can book Gibbys or Lucilles, and with a little effort, I can snag a reservation at Tuck shop or Pied de Cochon. More power to them if their status quo business model is working for them.

user_city: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
user_review: This is a 50s inspired diner that is kid-friendly. Just let them know if you are bringing kids and they seat you upstairs and out of the bar area. Our hotel recommended this spot for dinner and called ahead for us. David (possibly a manager) was great. He got us seated right away, even though they were busy. We were hungry so I got some fries as a starter to share with the table. The fries were a hit, but then again, I told you we were hungry. I had the maple rotisserie chicken, which was pretty good. The rice on the side, was very not good. I didn't even mess with it. Two in our party ordered the salmon. One salmon was sent back to cook longer and the  other had an undercooked part but he ate around it. Both said the flavor of the salmon was on point. Final Word: A cool and casual dinner place to check out.

With so many mouth-watering options to choose from it was funny that my lunch-mate and I both chose the Bacon-wrapped meatloaf. Funny, yes. Surprising, no; they had us at "bacon".Let me tell you, it was delicious! The belly-filling portion of meatloaf was accompanied by a mushroom and truffle sauce that was  absolutely wonderful - deep, embracing and rich! Veggies on the plate included - of course - mashed potatoes, as well as broccoli florets and (regrettably) a beautiful yet completely inedible carrot - a carrot so underdone that my knife could barely mar the surface. Both my companion and I left the gorgeous root uneaten on our plate.Service was excellent and friendly - from the hostess at the door to our delicately perfumed server. I can't wait to rediscover this "Diner" with other friends.

Cool diner with a hip club vibe that I would probably hate if I was back in LA, but here I kinda liked it.I was craving a burger, and turns out they have an entire page of burgers. In fact, their burger patty is a special three-meat blend. (I don't remember the three meats.)I was torn between a burger with bacon and loads of cheese, which is pretty much my go-to, or a unique one with a poached pear, brie cheese and red onion marmalade. I ended up going with the latter and was so happy I did. It was delicious!! As a side, I subbed in a house salad for the matchstick fries, which sounded great but I had fries with lunch already.Let me just say, the house salad is not your standard house salad. It had arugula - my fave! - candied pecans, shredded golden beets, grape tomatoes, parmesan and balsamic reduction. I absolutely loved it and could have eaten an entree-sized version. Again, the burger was delicious but I do have to say, the patty was a bit odd. I dont know if they cook it didn't than I'm used to or if it's a frozen patty vs fresh ground beef. All the things were great and I'm glad I tried something different than my usual.

Celebrated 2 birthdays with colleagues and we enjoyed our meals.The food is always tasty and made with love! I had The Drive in burger- which was a double patty, cheddar cheese, red onions, mayo, and the bun.... omG... the bun was sooo tasty and freshThe Deville Macho Salad that one of my colleague had was really good... the salad is composed of: rôtisserie free range chicken, avocado, crumbled goat cheese, corn bread crouton (she did not fancy it too much) and a champagne vinaigrette along with the other ingredients featured in the picture.I rate Deville 5 stars, for consistently delivering tasty dishes and always top quality.. Service: 2 stars, we made reservations for 5 people and asked for a booth and when we got there, we were told that booths can accomodate 4 people.. I was clear when I said we would like a booth as we are celebrating 2 birthday girls! The waiter who was not assigned to our table was sarcastic and fresh! Lacked people's skills and I wish I had taken note of his name because he definitely warrants some coaching. He was bothered that I had taken an extra napkin from the table next to ours. So if it was up to service only, I would not return... the chefs is the reason my colleagues and myself would return!

Went for a birthday celebration. It was calm and quiet. Not too much people. Food was amazingly delicious and generous. Definitely recommend and for sure I'll go back. _*Well I went back for a typical Friday night with the girls and once again we had a great service. We experienced the terrace which was a different vibe for a very cloudy day. Food was beyond amazing. Drinks were so so... not too much alcohol but ok.

Deville Dinebar is a pretty cool spot. I like the vibes and love the decor. The food is very American, and perfect for soaking up alcohol. We ordered a bunch of stuff but I definitely would come back for the apps. The mains were a lot to handle and pretty heavy. Keep Eating, Angela

Food was pretty good, but I was sitting across from the bar and watched the bartender make a couple of drinks tonight. He was making a couple of some sort of multilayered drink with I think Kahlua. He was trying to get the quantity even and poured more into his jigger to pour into the one shot. When he finished, he poured the remainder back into the bottle. Ew. He looked up and saw that I saw him. I didn't order a drink.

This is a cool spot to grab a bite to eat.  We came here for brunch (literally the only ones here).  It seems more of a evening spot - it does have that lounge kinda feel.  It's a huge space, with a second floor so definitely good for large groups.  The decor is a bit Vegas - their signature sign is pretty IG worthy! Full disclosure, as we were on a food crawl day and going somewhere else that day, I didn't get a meal here bc we were going to one of my fave eating spots in they city after, so my friends ordered the ahi tuna tacos.  The portion is pretty big, but so are the prices lol.  My friend said it was delicious and would have ordered more, but $$$I think this would be a great spot to grab drinks at the bar after work, get your IG photos in and grab a nibble or two.

I continue to love to come here because you cant go wrong.I've been frequenting this spot for awhile now and it really hits the ball out of park. The food is really well prepared and the menu is always interesting. They rotate some meals in and out throughout the year. I just had a Shephards Pie with braised beef that was really amazing. Their puff pastry was spot on, the potatoes were silky, and the beef was tender. My partner had a bourbon glazed steak that was also prepared nicely with a heaping pile of fried onions.The drinks here are also top notch, I've reviewed it before some years ago but they're still really good. And such a colorful drink menu as well.The only downside I would have to say is the price. It's a bit too expensive in my opinion , but because of the consistent quality of food that I've gotten here I cant dock a star.

I have been to Deville Dinerbar 3 times. Each time has been great experience. Twice was Birthday occasion and once girls' day occasion. The decor of the resto is pretty funky. The service is very amiable. Their cocktail menu and dish menu is very extensive. Every item in the menu is good; I know no one, my surroundings, ever been disappointed. My all time favorite dish is always and will Ahi Tuna taco...the taste and the mix crispy and soft and leafy texture is an absolute delight. Sadly it's a small portion as an appetizer, and expensive. Second favorite dish, that I always have fun with is Mac n Cheese wonton with marinara sauce. I discovered this creation of two items at this restaurant. Such delicious appetizer, yet expensive.Despite the high price, I always enjoyed this place. I think Ahi Tuna taco should be a main dish with extra few tacos...;)So I do recommend this place for the extensive succulent fusion food!

Looked on my trusty yelp for a good place to eat since the previous night's dinner sucked and this place, although a bit on the pricy side, was worth eating at:Bad girl pasta -  5 stars - this dish was the best of all that we ordered.  This pasta dish had a unique, smooth flavor of pasta sauce that we can't duplicate. The seafood tasted fresh, that included 3 large shrimp, mussels and scallop.Half rack of ribs - 4 stars - the ribs were very soft, melt in your mouth, and the bbq sauce was strong and sweet.Deville burger - 4 stars - the burger itself was huge and juicy with lettuce and tomato. Way better than the burger we ate at another restaurant previously. Came with a lot of string fries. Maple shake - 4 stars  - a huge, very sweet shake with whipped cream on top.Service - 5 stars - exceptionally great.Overall, 4 stars because it's very pricy for the type of food we ate.

The food and service is subpar at best. Considering the high price point of this restaurant, I expected more. Truthfully, the entire dining experience here is rather underwhelming. Since Deville is about a 5-minute walk from where I work, it's always seems like a convenient lunch, dinner or happy hour option. However, I've been terribly disappointed on my last few visits. The waiters that've served me have seemed uninterested and have had poor attitudes. It always feel like I'm inconveniencing them. The food is bland. On my most recent visit, I ordered the Tuna poke. While it was pretty to look at it, it didn't taste like much. On a positive note, they do have some of the best match stick fries I've ever eaten! If you visit, only order the fries and I guarantee you'd be the happiest person on this planet.It's also important to note, if you have dietary restrictions/concerns, this is not the place for you. There are no dairy-free, vegan or gluten-free options, and no accommodations/substitutes are available.

We made a last minute reservation and there was no problem! The booth is small and comfy, and is great for catching up with friends! Le Poulet au Gaufre is to die for!!! It's even better than the one from Prohibition! Drinks are on the pricier side. I ordered the Aloha cocktail and was disappointed with the drink being a glass inside a coconut and not just a drink in a coconut.Will come back one day for their famous donuts and their chicken waffle!

I mainly go to Deville for the atmosphere, their food is quite good, and the portions huge! I find the service really depends on how busy the place is, I typically go on Sunday afternoons (not too busy) so honestly never been disappointed by the service.

Went here for my friends birthday on a Saturday night. We were all seated on the second floor. Let's start with the negative so we can get it out of the way. The tables are bit small and we all felt very crammed into each other. Menu's are bulky and difficult to manage when you are so close to the person next to you. It is also more difficult when in winter and everybody has coats. I would recommend give more space to customers.Now let's get to the better part of the review, we were in total 11 people, we were quickly greeting by our waiter that gave some recommendations. He came by at least twice to see if we had any questions about the menu.  What I was most impressed about was the timing, they brought our drinks and about 10 minutes brought our appetizers once all appetizers were done they waited 15 minutes and brought all plates and the same time, so we could all eat at the same time, which I really appreciated.Az an appetizer I shared the calmari which was very good and specially liked the spicy sauce it had a good kick. I ordered the deville burger, which I really enjoyed, juice, nicely seasoned with wonderful condiments. The bun was so good and the fries were to die for. Everybody loved their food, from the salads to the meatloaf.At the end we ordered their fabulous beignets which came with two sides, chocolate and caramel sauce. Fluffy inside and a nice crust on the outside.Also the drinks were really yummy, I had the fish bowl sangria which was so huge, but also one of the best sangria's I ever had.Deville Dinerbar is a great place for a group event, or a girls/boys night out. Very noisy and busy place, so if you are planning for a quiet romantic evening, this place is not for you.A huge thanks to our waiter, who was well informed, patient, and funny.

Way slicker than your average diner. You won't find boring milkshakes and burgers here. Their menu is intense... innovative apps like bacon wrapped hot dog sliders and mini lobster rolls. Decadent entrees - lots of different steak and seafood options. Burgers, gourmet salads and pastas, boozy shakes. The list goes on and on. The restaurant is set up to look like a flashy old school diner and they pull it off well. The menu was a overwhelming! My fiance knew he wanted a classic burger and fries, but I took a bit longer to settle on my order. I went with the macho salad - rotisserie chicken, avocado, goat cheese, corn, dates, tomatoes and thick and crunchy cornbread croutons tossed in a tangy vinaigrette. The salad came served in a massive bowl and was filling and delicious. The rotisserie chicken was moist and well seasoned and was definitely the highlight of the salad bowl. My guy's burger was juicy and dripping with cheese. I really liked the side of thin and crunchy shoestring fries. The only downside is price - expect to pay over 20 dollars for a burger or salad. Luckily the hearty portions made up for that.I'd suggest making a reservation. We didn't, and were only able to sit at one of the high tops and not in the main dining room. Completely fine, but I also didn't expect this at 9 PM on a weekday. So call ahead for sure. Denville Dinerbar is a great spot for quality food in a trendy environment. I have a feeling that it's impossible to go wrong with anything on this menu.

Has high hopes after reading reviews. Vibe was awesome, music on point. Our server was very nice. Drinks were smooth. I ordered the black label burger as i was told its the most popular. Honestly wayyy too greasy for my liking. And dry. It was basically a whole lotta meat + cheese and nothing else. Sounded good but was missing something and my fingers were drenched by the end. Taking a bite of the burger was like eating a sponge soaked in oil. Maybe a bad choice for me personally. I stole a bite from my husbands "screaming Korean chicken" and that was good but also not for me. I will def come again to try something different.

One moment I'm strolling in the action packed hustle and bustle of downtown Montreal, the next I find myself  in....actually I'm not sure what this is. It's an old school diner, yet it's modern; Deville resembles a future-fied diner. It's basically like something out of the jetsons(so sad I'm old enough to know what the jetsons are). The menu reads more like a short novel, of course not to the level of a Cheesecake Factory(that's more like the food encyclopedia), but lengthy nonetheless and full of fun and creative options. Ahi tuna tacos: is anything not good in taco form? The tuna is fresh and perfectly rare. The sauce served on the side is phenomenal. With three to an order, these can probably serve as a main dish rather than an appetizer. These tacos are loaded and pack a ton of flavor. I do mean literally loaded, so much so that it's bound to explode in your hand after one bite. You've been warned....an inevitable delicious mess. Mac and cheese wontons: yes, you read that correctly. Another entree sized meal disguised as an appetizer with five to an order! This concept doesn't even really make sense and honestly shouldn't work, but oh does it work. Creamy Mac and cheese somehow neatly nestled in a fried dough pocket, not at all greasy and pretty satisfying on its own. The kicker? The marinara dipping sauce, perfect pairing. Again, this shouldn't work! This isn't a mozzarella stick, why marinara?! This is clearly the work of an evil genius.....It is fair to note that Deville may be a little pricey for a quick bite(closer to $$$ than $$), but they do have a verity of lunch special options for the budget minded.

Had dinner here after Working up an appetite from hiking the Mt Royal. If was a cute trendy diner, definitely nothing like the old diners we have in brooklyn.If i could I would've ordered the entire menu!!!I had the max n cheese dumplings, Philly cheesesteak rolls and the best red velvet milkshake ever!!I still think about the yummy Mac n cheese dumplings

No words can explain how good the food and atmosphere was at this place all I can and will say is I was in town for a week and ate there every day all items where great would recommend this owner coming to Los Angeles there is space for this type of establishment!! See you when you get here!

Deville Dinerbar is the perfect place to indulge in some of the best comfort foods in Downtown Montreal #cheatday. It's also a great place to bring a group of girlfriends to enjoy giant fishbowl cocktails in a retro, '50s-style, chic American diner.I've always had a good time at Deville and almost always love what I'm eating. It is a little pricey but that can be explained by the yummy food, the cool vibes and the attentive service in a great location. My favourite go-to appetizers are the mac n cheese wontons and the deep fried pickles. Trust me, if you order these 2 appetizers, you're already off to a really good start. I love their salads as a main course because they're huge and filling (I usually take 1/2 to go) but more importantly, they make you feel better about your decision to indulge in those two deep fried appetizers.My favourite meal is the Neptune Ahi Tuna salad. At $26.50, it better be damn good -- and it is. If you're carnivorous and chuckle at the thought of ordering a salad on a night out, their burgers are delicious and ridiculously huge too so I guess you get more bang for your buck. Their drinks are fun, and their desserts and shakes are ridiculously decadent.I love this place but I only like to go for special occasions -- for the sake of my wallet and my waistline  I'm due for another visit!!

Please note i only went there for drinksTheir food looks to die for but on the pricey endDrinks range from $12 1.5 ro 2 oz oz of alcohol to $26 about 4 to 5 oz of alcohol$26 is a giant fish bowl Drinks are average Decor of the place is cute pink modern retro styleBartenders are funny, service is good

I had only been to Deville once before and had a great experience which was the readon for my second visit. I had remembered how delicious the Mac& Cheese wontons were and decided to order them again. For my main I ordered the Deville Burger and replaced the cheddar cheese with goat cheese! Unfortunately it wasn't like I remembered it. The mac & cheese wontons came cold which was really deceiving. My burger was good but also not so warm. The food took long to come so I would assume it would at least come warm. I was a little disappointed with my second visit, not to mention Deville is also a little on the pricey side for what you get. Don't know if I'll go back.

Came here the other day because it was close-ish to my work, and took a friend. The aesthetic of the place is very unique - a sort of early 2000s look that I'm surprised to see as a deliberate choice, given that it looks a bit like a seedy nightclub from 15 years ago. The inside was dark, purple, and incredibly loud, so we chose to sit outside. The weather was nice, and it was a much better dining/talking experience. The menu was impressive, large, and full of creative dishes, but it was also surprisingly expensive - even the most standard burger cost $17, which I don't really feel was warranted by either the decor or the quality.Don't get me wrong, the food was excellent - I had the Korean fried chicken sandwich, for $20 - but it really gouged out a hole in my pocket that I wasn't expecting from a place that has "diner" in its name. I'm giving this place 4 stars because the food really is very good, but I just don't think it merits being as expensive as fancy dining.

I am enjoying all sorts of business, friendships & even dating at your great place since you open some 6 years ago! I simply like to say thanks  for all those great moments fullfiled with the kindness & professionalism of your staff & of course the highest quality of your dishes both in diversity & delicacy!The Best SW American Dinner in the NE  :)The Best QQP* in #MTL as well!   *Quality-Quantity-Price!See you soon for another amazing moment & foodist blast!
Charging me for 2 diet cokes is lame as hell at $3.50 each considering its watery fountain pop..  pretty disappointing to be honest that's pretty low

This was the best service, meal, place that we experienced on our first trip to Montréal. Danielle's excellent service included a history of the restaurant and details of menu items.  She worked hard but never lost a winning personality.  We started with the Mac and cheese wontons.  Unusual, but good.  Hubby's beef ribs and my sirloin were tender and well seasoned.  Our first taste of bone marrow, not for me but beautifully plated.  Everything came to the table fresh and hot.  We wanted to eat somewhere different each night, so we didn't return.  But Deville will be on repeat for our next visit.

The atmosphere inside the place is very cool and the purple colors are amazing! We start with the Calimari which was super greasy and no good at all. Our burger choice was the black and it was double a lot of cheese and so oily! I felt full after 3 bites The fries are so thin and very tasty I loved them! They are known by their big balls of douantes! We ordered one but then we took it to go because we were full but we tried before and it's very tasty

The food and services are great!Deville is a restaurant that has a little bit of fusion style of food, tuna taco, fried wonton,etc.The must try must be the tuna taco with their homemade sauce, amazing!!I had a problem choosing the main course because... They have so much choices and I wanted to try everything!So this time I chose... Cheese burger and new York rib steak, I was with my wife so we shared.The steak is very juicy, it served with grill vegetables as a match.The cheese burger is one of those burger that you have to eat with fork and knife. They use good quality sesame buns with 2 beef patty and Swiss cheese.It's a highly recommended place to be for a great dinner!

I was always nervous to eat at this restaurant because of the huge bar as the focal point. However a friend always suggested to have breakfast or lunch here which I finally did.  I love the dark themed restaurant with pink and purple accented colours. The restaurant is very pretty and well kept. Our server was very polite, explained the menu and items very well. The dishes have unique and fun names. My friends and I had a few appetizers as we were headed for the movies. I had the fried calamari with sauce which I really liked. I also liked the mac & cheese samosas which came with a sauce as well and was quite filling. I had a hard time finishing it. The calamari came with this amazing dipping sauce and I used that for the samosas (which I couldn't finish). Definitely worth going again to try other food items.

I'll start by saying you should order the Pain Perdu for desert. Vanilla Ice cream with raspberry sauce on mini-French toast type things covered in cinnamon sugar with a side of syrup. Reminds me of the mini Donuts you get at country fairs or sports arenas. Totally decadent and amazing. Burgers are big and loaded with different combos of creative toppings like glazed pork belly, onion rings, Panko fried Gouda, fried eggs and so on. Big menu so take your time to really go through it. Kind of expensive but worth it. The potions are quite large. Friendly helpful staff rounded out a pleasant first time to this modern take on a 50s diner.

Visiting in the Summer 2016 I recall finding this place a bit by accident. We were shopping in downtown Montreal then the skies decided to open up and rain down upon us so we were like oh quick.. a diner.. that will do for lunch! But it turned out be a bit more "elevated" than the diners we are used to back in the States. I came in feeling under dressed seeing other business types around, but still was comfortable - it wasn't an issue.We started off with some delicious and beautiful looking trio of mini-lobster rolls. They were really tasty and generously filled with hunks of lobster meat. For our mains we went with Deville Nacho salad which was really fresh and the rotisserie chicken was some of the most juicy & tender I ever tried. We also did the Blue cheese Iceberg that was also very good.Our first visit was a 5 star surprise - excellent food and service across the board. So much so that we decided to go back a second time later that week when we found ourselves in the area and hungry. That visit was not too memorable. The burger I ordered was way overcooked - "well done" and a bit on the dry side. I don't remember what else we ordered - perhaps I blocked out this experience preferring to remember Deville in the best possible light of our first meeting!UPDATE 1/5/17: As you can see from Annie N, Business Manager's comment to my review they take much care and attention to detail with their restaurant! I am sure they would have corrected the issue I had on my second visit, but I am not one to send food back and waste it (unless its a serious issue such as being raw or spoiled). Deville is great spot that I recommend when in Downtown Montreal.

What a fun place!I had a delicious burger (the cirque) that had brie and pear on it.  My milkshake was thick and loaded with strawberry.  Our waiter was quite helpful.  My MIL got the mac and cheese, and I wish I had ordered that. We all enjoyed our food, so A+!

Wonderful Hip place, that if you're in the area it's a must try! Creative menu which awesome combination of tastes that work really well. Convienent downtown location, near everything. If we lived here, I would be a repeat offender!

I have been to Deville Dinebar one other time and remembered they had a fun menu for drinks which inspired my second visit on a cold winter evening. I had made reservations using open table for 4 people at 5 pm. Making my way up to the second floor was a nuisance, as there is one long alley/walkway for clients and the staff to use. No coat hooks nearby with little space for storing personal items. The layout on the second floor is very crammed compared to the spacious first floor. Funny story: the hostess placed me and my friends at two separate tables when we had one reservation under my name. How does that happen??? When I asked our waiter in regards to the mix up, he termed it "a glitch in the system". Glitch or confusion? Menu: the menus are bulky and rather large to use in a tiny space you're stuck in. Yet these menus are fun! Drink specials are offered daily -and I was surprised to even see a fish bowl menu, haven't seen fish bowls around in Mtl. I ended up ordering gummies on the beach with their 2$ off the candy bar menu on Thursdays. This drink was a twist on a sex on the beach with gummy bears that tasted oddly gelatinous because they were served chilled-(for 11$ it was an ok drink). The food menu was on the pricey side. Starting at 20$ on average going up to 40$ per main course. They specialize in American cuisine. I tried the ahi tuna tacos (4/5) for 22$ that came in 3 servings-i really enjoyed the flakey taco shell with the slaw and a genius slice of tuna-lightly grilled on the outside. For my main course: I had the short back beef ribs with Mac n cheese (3/5) the portion was very generous and presentation was beautiful. The meat was cooked super well, very tender, but the seasoning was a tad on the salty side. Whereas, the mac n cheese was a bit on the underseasoned side. The two served together didn't really jive well for me. I was glad to have tried it.Service: I wasn't too happy with the service we received, frankly because I felt rushed into ordering right away. I really appreciated the fact the servers knew the menu inside out, they were good with making recommendations -but a lot of the items from the drink menu were also missing. This was an eventful dining experience but for the 100$ I dropped I would've rather gone with a more upscale restaurant in old Montreal.  Overpriced meals for the quality of the food you get!

Calling this place a diner is very deceiving. Yes they resemble a diner inside, but the prices and type of food are very different. Food was good but on the pricey side for sure. When I think diner, I think comfort foods. Food here is more on the fancy side then diner style food. Overall it was okay but definitely not worth what we paid.
All I have to say is the meatloaf is bomb! Trust in your bartender or server when you ask them about it. Get outside your burger comfort zone and get the meatloaf

Deville Dinerbar's on my go-to list every time I visit Montréal, a diner-meets-cool, casual cocktail bar concept where the food is consistently good and the staff is quite friendly and welcoming. Like any good diner, Deville's menu is huge (français à l'avant, English in the back), offering a variety of burgers, sandwiches, salads, pasta dishes, and a variety of desserts and shakes (yes, boozy ones, too).My go-to burger here is the Deville: two beef patties with cheddar, lettuce, tomato, grilled onions, pickle chips, and their signature sauce, all stacked onto a very fresh, lightly grilled brioche bun that holds up to all that wonderfulness to the very last bite. The burgers are a blend of aged beef brisket, chuck, and short rib, a great combination that's absolutely delicious! The blend is what makes this burger special, a much better 'steak burger' than the ones served up by places like The Palm. The burger is accompanied by matchstick fries, and I appreciate that they're served in a small metal bowl - matchstick fries tend to lose their heat quickly, but the metal bowl help keeps them hot longer.Deville is right down the block from the Peel Metro station and a short walk from the Musée des beaux-arts on Sherbrooke. It's a perfect place for a low-key lunch when you're out and about exploring Centre-Ville, with something for everyone!

I've been a couple more times since my first review and haven't encountered the same type of experience again so it felt right to update my review. Although not the best food in the city, there are still some great options if you pick right. Service has been good the last 2 times I came here so adding a star to my initial review accordingly!

Decided to come in for a quick lunch and ended up staying for 3 hours !We were seated in the back which I found weird but it was okay.They don't have that many options for food salad, few pasta dishes, a bunch of burgers and appetizers.Our waiter was very friendly and helpful but since it was 5 he left and we switched over to another guy.We asked to be seated in the bar area so we can have drinks and relax.Our waiter was okay at first but then barely came by and asked if I needed anything or about maybe getting me a drink.The Long Island ice tea was garbage tasted terrible BUT the old fashion drinks were great.Two girls walked in and went upstairs to eat and I seen them come down 30 minutes later and left. I was watching all the waiters laughing at them calling them transgender and mocking one of the girls voices I was disgusted by this behaviour I called the guy over just to get him to stop talking and laughing about this girl. He came over I had a very angry looked on my face I figured he would pick up on it but no he didn't and went right back to the bar to laugh some more about the woman who left.Half the staff is standing around doing nothing 3 people at the door just playing on their phones 2 standing in the stair case 4 laughing at the bar. I don't know how that's acceptable.I would return but Probably not for a while.-UPDATE- spoke with social media manager and all was handled and taken care of in a professional manner very happy to hear.Update Decided to finaly come for lunch and try it out again. The waiter explained how only certain promotions u can get at the bar so we had to move our seat even tho nobody was in the place. The salad with the blue cheese is usually my thing decided why not try it again and I was extremely sick from it which I find weird because there's nothing much to it besides the blue cheese. My friend had the chicken Cesar salad and he liked it but was sick after as well. I'm not sure if it was just the dressings they used but I was sick for a full day.

a bit overpriced for a basic burger. fries were good but a bit oily. the drinks are very diluted so i dont recommend spending 12$ on a very weak cocktail. service was good although they hand you the machine with 15% of tips already included.
Poutine and Jalepeno Cornbread is ! LOVED IT! We ordered the Fish N Chips and Gus Salad and it was very good as well! Probably the best food that we had I Montréal! Highly recommended!

This is really one of those places where you can go out and have a great time. It was my 3rd time here, but it's been a few years...and I've definitely waited too long to come back. I always loved their menu...kinda like higher end comfort food. I went for the country fried steak. Portions are large, just like I like it. And everything I ate was delicious. Nice drink selection too. I only wish I had room for dessert! Hopefully next time!

I love this place : they already got me just for the pink color and the bit-retro look.I like to come here once in a while for drinks or a burger. It is conveniently located, right downtown, next to Peelmetro.I tried their salad tonight (Macho Deville) and my friend had one too and both very delicious. We are also never deceived by their burgers !! They have a special fun drinks menu. Every night there's a different special, but drinks are 10-14$ maybe ? I ordered one of their drinks that comes in a coconut and was at 50 deceived to pay 14$ for a glass that they've put into an old coconut (to hold it... ) but my drink was really good.Their fries are really yummy too !!!! Good retro music. Not too loud OK to talk We had a really fun waiter tonight !!Je fais juste rentrer dans le restaurant et ils m'ont déjà avec le look un peu rétro et la couleur rose !!! J'adore l'ambiance de ce resto pour venir manger un burger ou prendre un verre !! C'est vraiment bien situé, c'est à côté du métro Peel. Ils ont un menu l'fun, avec des spéciaux sur les drinks (un différent à chaque soir). Tous les drinks à date on les a aimé !! J'étais juste un peu déçue que mon drink dans une coconut a été servi comme un drink dans un verre, mis dans une coconut sèche.On aime beaucoup leur frite allumette. Bonne musique, OK pour avoir une conversation décente sans crier.Mention pour le serveur qui était vraiment drôle et qui a pris la peine de nous jaser.

Love the trendy decor and neon lights. The atmosphere is comfortable yet chic, a good trendy date spot I'd say. Service was fast and friendly, and was helpful for recommendations because they have a pretty expansive menu.They had a $40 a la carte deal going on, which gets you a starter, main, and dessert. Seriously worth it, considering the prices of the components.For starters, we got the fried mac and cheese wontons. You only get 3 things of it, which is not a lot at all, judging the price they sell it at. Also it was more like fried perogies, those were defo not wonton wrappers you guys. Delicious nonetheless.I got the ribs for the main, which came with coleslaw and a cornbread muffin. I was super satisfied with this dish, the slaw was delish, the ribs fell off the bone, and I couldn't even finish my fries. (Interesting fries btw, super thin, like chips)And for dessert we got the apple pie. Apples wrapped in pastry with ice cream on top ughhhh you honestly can't go wrong with that. All in all, the food was delicious and it was a great dining experience, but the prices were too high. Understandable to some degree: (downtown, big restaurant, big menu) but it's not a place you can go to all the time.

Great upscale place to go with friends or on your own. They have different drink special every night and bar staff is always friendly and coming up with a great suggestion on what to get based on your tastes. Cool spot to hit up before a night out downtown !

It's hard to rate this place as a vegetarian... it's a great place for drinks with girl friends (though pricey). However for food it's a hit or miss. Went with a large group of non vegetarians, not everyone was happy with their burgers, salmon was overdone, mac and cheese wasn't hot enough... presentations were all very nice though.Oh and the chocolate cake was horrible. The buttercream tasted like Crisco, while the bottom cake layer had a garlicky taste to it!

Service was fantastic! Our waiter was very attentive and our drinks and food arrived very quickly, even though it was pretty busy. We had our 4 kids with us, and our waiter was great with our 1 year old! Our food was also delicious, it was everyone's favorite meal from our vacation!

Amazing food. Amazing drinks. Amazing service. Came here for dinner our last night in Montreal. There was a bit of a wait after we were seated because of a water leak in the kitchen, but our server kept an open line of communication the entire time. Loved the range of cocktail drinks and extensive food options. Our waiter, Jordan, was absolutely incredible and gave us great recommendations: Bad Girl pasta, short ribs with Mac and cheese and the mussels with fries. All tasted delicious. The Oreo cookie ice cream sandwich was one of the best deserts I've ever had. Will definitely be coming back if ever in Montreal again. Thanks!

Food was overpriced and pretty basic, I ordered a chicken waldorf salad which was 28$ plus tax (could have easily prepared it at home.) Waiter told my friend he couldn't have half rice half fries as a side, and didn't tell him why. Both of us had indigestion after (uncommon for us) and ended up going home instead of enjoying the rest of our evening downtown. If you want to spend a lot of money on good food, this isn't the place to go!

Great food, but it's pricey. Nevertheless, I really like this spot. Came here for the second time decided to try the "Bad Girl Pasta" dish, LOVED IT... Don't know the reason for the name but the food was not bad AT ALL.Definitely not worth $36, so I will never buy it again, but it really was delicious. (being from Nova Scotia, 3 scallops & 3 muscles should never be $36.00).With that said, this is a GREAT spot for a group of friends, a date or if u want to order takeout, or sit at the bar alone, it's all good to do that as well.

I came in expecting something more than what a diner would provide after seeing high reviews, and I was clearly wrong. It's a diner.Lasagna was definitely frozen then fried, and somehow the stuffing was unevenly distributed. Bad girl was ok.Not recommended for tourist~

Giving Deville 5/5 for their Delicious calamari.  It was so good we ordered it twice.  Other items are very good we enjoyed the lamb shank, honey and BBQ ribs.  The meats were fall of the bone tender and the smoke flavor was to the bone. Portion sizes were huge, we could barely finish.  We ordered the driink special for the night which was a Mojito.  It was pineapple flavored but the flavors worked well together and the bartender mixed them perfectly.  We ordered another round of them but they weren't as good as the first--I suspect a different bartender mixed them.   Service was excellent no complaints.

Every time I come to this cute little spot next to peel metro I fall inlove!!The interior decor was always very chic and welcoming. They went through renovations in the winter to make the place bigger and easier to move around. It looks beyond belief amazing! I really think they do what is best for their customers. The atmosphere is very friendly and pleasant!The service: one word: Spectacular. They always try their hardest to get you the best table possible even when its very crowded and they are amazing over the phone to reserve a table for me when I come down to the resto. I seriously think they're one of the best restos in terms of service.The food: Not the best but definitely beats many other mediocre places. Why I say not the best .. Their menu is great and creative it's just the execution is very poor. I sometimes get very dry overcooked meals. I don't think it's their fault. They can get super busy and not always have the food on point. Their trout, salmon, lamb which I've all ordered in the past came out a little too dry but the flavours are all their! Their coconut onion rings are delicious! Their chilli cheese steak spring-rolls are to die for.Their cocktails are so pretty and exotic! I always go for the Hawaii 5-0 cocktail. I tried their martini once. It was very strong so we know they are not cheap on the alcohol content! Hahaha. The best desert is their Beignet/ donuts! A little advice: Order them during your meal because it takes around 30minutes to have them freshly prepared. So when it comes out they are so warm and succulent. Overall, I love love love Deville and it's one of the most prettiest places I have been to and their service is TOP notch ! They always have the food on time with a smile! I totally recommend this dinner bar

Fancified bar food in a Johnny Rockets meets Vegas with a dose of pink lighting setting.  Food is okay but some combinations didn't make much sense.  Prices are on the high side for the food served and I enjoyed the food I did get although I didn't find them better than what I got for lower prices in Bier Market near by.Lamb lollipops were good overall although they were a little burned and I could taste some charred bits that weren't pleasant. The giant steamed broccolis were well buttered and tasted fine, once you remember why we serve broccoli with the stem removed. Ribeye on Mac and Cheese gave me mixed feelings.  The ribeye was very tender but was on the bland side itself. The sauce only made it worse, completely overpowering the meat.  I still finished it but i won't order it again.TLDR: a decent fancified interpretation of American bar and diner foods but a little overpriced for what you actually get.

I've been going to Devil frequently and Was never disappointed. If you have a big appetite try the Fat Cat. The meat was a bit dry but besides the burger was tasty and great. The grilled oignon was perfectly caramelized and had the right amount of spicy sauce to enjoy this burger.The pink light gives this restaurant a cozy aspect with its own signature.The place is clean and the lets not forget the good service we had. I would like to point out that the waitress was very respectful.

Yes Deville stills offers good food and inventive. But since their renovations the menu changed. Yes they added more choices which is fantastic but they also added $$$$. (Maybe we are paying for their reno) This restaurant unfortunately can no longer be our regular place. Its quite ridiculous the prices. Not to mention charging for fountain drinks $3.50 no refills. And if you order appetizers...your bill will come out to minimun $50 for one person and thats not including dessert. Add another $15-18. I ordered one if the cheapest item which is the fish and chip sandwich. It was ok but not great. My husband orderd the koren fried chicken sandwich,  that was delicious. All in all if you have the bucks go for it. But quite disappointing when we saw the same food items we ordered two years ago go up by easily $10. I understand a few dollars but $10. That's crazy!

My friend picked this diner to eat tonight. I wasn't thrilled about it. If you like big portions this is the place to go. Im not big on junk food so this was not my kind of place. Fried won tons with Mac and cheese inside had no flavour. Pork belly sliders was fatty. Dessert banana cream pie was good and make sure it is shared with someone, like I said they believe in  everything  bigger is better..
Always such a pleasure to spend a night at Deville! Whether for a date night or a girls night out or a special occasion, deville always offers excellent service & excellent cuisine.

I love this place. A very unique restaurant with a super cool ambiance. The server speaks English and French. It is located in downtown Montreal. I had the burger and the meat was juicy and it's antibiotic beef patty. The patty is amazing!!!! The French fries were amazing. They were very unique and thin.The shack was amazing and creamy. I loved it so much. All in all, i love this place. Would defiantly come again !!!! :)

Pulled lamb pasta was fantastic. The "nice little house salad" was good but arugula/beets in balsamic for $12 is on the steeper side. Plating is above average. Service solidly good but unexceptional. Ambience: lounge lighting + funk/house music playlist give this place a trendy vibe, great for dates or cooling with youthful coworkers. Downstairs has a more casual drinks feel, upstairs to the back is nice for dining. 4 stars on the strength of the pasta/ambience.Bonus: bathrooms are impressively hotel-quality clean.

user_city: East Market Street A, Greensboro, NC
user_review: Great location and atmosphere! Food was absolutely delicious. Ordered the Kopanisti Dip & Chips and the Pulled Lamb Pasta. The only reason I'm not giving this place 5 stars is because our waitress spent a lot of time talking to the other waiters and didn't seem to be paying much attention to us. Took forever for her to come back and take our food order and then took forever for us to get our check. If you're not in a rush, this place is great and would highly recommend.

Wow. Deville was pure bliss and definitely worth all the hype!Decor/ambiance: Super cute with a 1950s Grease meets pop art style.  Cute menu with interesting names and a retro look/feel Drinks: A number of interesting cocktails in the quite heavy cocktail menu.  I ended up ordering a French 75 because I was just in the mood Appetizer: We ordered the poutine (Deville Poutine?), it wasn't very memorable.  I'm not a fan of poutine (there I said it!).  Burger: Let's skip to the good stuff.  I ordered the cirque burger which had the brie, the pears, a thick juicy double layer of burger meat, and I was feeling like a million dollars.  The burger tasted divine and my taste buds were in satisfaction and heaven. Highly recommend it. Check: Best part of Canada is that we can split a check between 20 girls by paying individually (I LOVE IT)Misc: My waiter was cute and attentive, so I approve of the service too :)
Impressive service and great tasting food. The milkshakes are a must try. Can be a bit pricey but worth it.
My experience was amazing because my bartender was amazing. He took the time out to dish out some history about Montréal as well as offer me some local suggestions !!! The burger was delicious too!!!

Cool retro diner with a hearty menu. Service was efficient. We did all appys at our visit. The ahi tacos are divine! May have to go back for more.  We also had the poutine which had thin fries and tasted delicious. The beef lettuce wraps were pretty good too. Very interesting twist on regular food. Loved it!

~70$ for 5 Mac and Cheese wonton and a meal of 3 small pieces of fish served on tostadas, salad and rice... That is ridiculously pricey. It was good but not what you'd expect for a price like that. It is not worth it.

The DinerBar is the prettiest diner you may ever see.  Too bad their food doesn't match!  I would never eat here again!  This establishment is expensive for no apparent reason.  I ordered the fish on a bun and there was more bun and batter than fish.  The french fries were the skinniest I'd ever seen & full of salt.  I was thoroughly disappointed.  If you're a vegan or a vegetarian, this is NOT an establishment for you.  There is literally NOTHING on the menu for us to eat.

Excellent services, and honest waiter. Nice ambiance. Dishes are ok for the price. They should have more beer selections and local beers. Wine list is thin and not that great. Difficult to find parking around the restaurant. I still would give 4 stars due to services and I believe the price is right but a little higher than other restaurants.
Best lobster roll in the entire city. Great atmosphere and friendly service. Highly recommend this place.

I was quite disappointed w the meal. The service was good but the food was really average and that's generous. The calamari was good. We had been here a few years ago and it was all delicious but tonight....not good. Shame. Great location but the food is not worth it. Ps thanks for the reply. Actually what I said was the calamari was GOOD. really good. Everything else was NOT GOOD.
Large portion with a lot of ingredients that will fill you up for sure. Very good food and great customer service.

So happy we found this place on our last night in Montreal, despite being a bit more pricey, definitely our best visit of the weekend. The drinks were great, the crushed ice cocktails were not too strong and not too sweet, and the regular cocktails were amazing (blackberry lemonade was the best of the few I tried). Our server was Kealey, who was extremely nice and helped by making suggestions for drinks and food. I had the lobster BLT which was excellent, and the fries were amazing. Definitely worth the price as the atmosphere was extremely comfortable as well, will definitely be back next time I'm in Montreal !

I came back to Deville because some of my friends wanted to go for a fun lunch on a Tuesday. I was pleasantly surprised, I was craving a really good burger and what I got was AMAZING (black label), and they cooked it medium which is very rare in Montreal. A few wine bottles are also 50% off on Tuesdays so all in all, I guess im changing my mind when it comes to Deville, depending what you order! Enjoy
Good food but expensive for what it was. I'd argue '$$$' rather than Yelp's current '$$' for the place.

The food is OK and it's very pricy, but the portions are GIANT. The pink lighting is a very specific vibe that I don't mix with, but if that's your thing, then you'll enjoy it. The photos give a pretty accurate view of the atmosphere.You pay money for the size of what you're given... good for instagram. At the same time the actual food is just meh. You eat here to impress, but not to genuinely enjoy.I'd say the food is $$$ not $$ as it says above

If you're looking for good food and drink and trendy funky atmosphere, you've found it here. I liked the food here but wasn't mind blowing. Everything is very pink and retro with a modern twist you could say. Food options seem original and fusion style. I got the seared ahi tuna crusted with peanut butter and popcorn. The sweet and salty actually worked very well together and was on a bed of curry risotto. Comes with a small Waldorf kale salad but wasn't a fan. Too much dressing and tasted like nail polish, although one of their more popular salad.$39Food is pricey here. Each main is $30 up. Apps are $15+Our server was wonderful and service was excellent.

The decoration and menu look fun. As appetizer, we ordered the Ahi Tuna Taco as... but sadly the Tuna is not fresh... very disappointment. The bad girl pasta is ok. The neptune ahi tuna salad is very watery, The tuna is not fresh, I am sure they are not immediately made... a lot of onion... very disappointed too. I find them pricy for the quality of foods.
The food was great , chilled environment, and the portions are big enough to make sure you leave satisfied. The waiter was nice and friendly
Food was good and service was okay. I made reservation before going, so there's no need to wait.

We ate here on our last night in Montreal. Probably best that we did on our last night bc I probably would have only eaten here it was that good. I rely on yelp a lot while traveling. My bf is somewhat of a picky eater so we have to manage both our styles. The menu here seemed to meet both our likings so we gave it a shot. The drinks to start were delicious. So many different funky options! Then we ordered the Salt & Pepper Calamari which was very tasty. This dish was a bit on the salty side, but when dipped in the sauce it really delicious. From here I was really having a hard time deciding on what to get for dinner. There were so many options I wanted to try. I decided to go another appetizer and a salad. My boyfriend got the Drive In burger and commented that it was juicy & the well put together. I went with The Blue Cheese Iceberg salad and the Southern Fried Buttermilk Chicken Crispers. Both were really good but I ended up loving the salad a little bit more. The chicken dish was the perfect balance of sweet & salty. The salad was huge for one, but soooo good. Just the right amount of everything on it. I would definitely not skip over this place if you're visiting Montreal. We will be back for sure!
Wow from the paella to the hanger steak. The bad girlfriend pasta is a must and the mussels amazing.

Service 5/5, ambient 5/5, food 5/5. I don't have much to say about this place. I can only say, not to exaggerate, this is probably one of best restaurant I've been.I love the decors in here. Pink lights, good music. Server was polite and fluent in both English and French. Our food were amazing, good portion, amazing taste. Everything was upscale but affordable.Will visit again for sure the next time when I hit up Montreal.

I wasn't expecting pink but it suits the restaurant very well! Now, the food, it was okay, not the best but not the worst! The service was not the fastest though. For the price I expected a bit more but it was still a good experience. This should be like a $$ and a half. The decor is very easy on the eye and comfortable seats! Televisions everywhere, and interesting drinks. By the way, try out the banana split milkshake, I recommend that!!!

Ok, here's deal: the aesthetics of this place make you feel like you're eating at a strip club in the airport, and the prices fit that feeling, but the food is, given all this, surprisingly good. I had the drive-in burger with house smoked bacon and fries for $20, and I have to say it was awesome. The fried chicken and waffles were also good as was the fish burger. This is a good relatively affordable option for the area (we were catching a movie nearby).

Good experience overall. My chicken club sandwich was very tasty especially with the toasted brioche bread, fresh avocado and maple smoked bacon. The chicken was extremely tender. My only complaint was the sandwich was too tall to bite. Really. You could not do it. I had to take bites at the edges to eat away at the sandwich.

Food was great. Price point? Not sure. Philly Cheesteak spring rolls -- 3 of them for $17. But they were tasty. Mussels and fries for $24 pretty decent. Came here on a Monday after 9pm...happy hour drink prices only apply if you sit at the bar! A great place to impress a crowd.

I love the twist on your favorite diner favs but done in an elevated way. Chicken and waffles, adult milkshakes, and slamming burgers. Everything is super delicious here. The place feels like a diner but with a modern twist! A little darker in ambiance with bright pink accent lighting for a fun pop! The music is fun and exciting and definitely has a vibe to get your night started.

Got a late lunch there - it was during the day of World Cup game and they had huge TVs so perfect for games watching! Absolutely loved their tuna salad - such great portion and so yum! The chicken was okay.
Overpriced and rude staff. I'd recommend finding another place (especially if you are on vacation and have limited time in town)!

An aesthetically pleasing restaurant, playing off the 50s diner theme. The tables are well spaced so there was no akward bumping into other guests, and seating was comfy. It took us a couple minutes to order because the menu is pretty big. We were brought the main menu, a specials menu, and a drink menu. The main menu consists of salads, burgers, pasta, and steaks. We started with the mac and cheese wontons. Five mac and cheese deep fried wontons served with marinara sauce on the side. I was afraid they would be too crispy to enjoy, but they were lightly fried. Nothing too exciting about the taste but I would not change anything.I was told Deville does burgers right so I asked our waiter for some options. He recommended the Circus burger (~$19): two beef patties, bourbon soaked pears, a dolop of caramelized onion marmalade, and brie cheese on brioche buns. The first bite introduced me to the juicy patties. Well seasoned. Every bite after brought me the sweet taste of pear, smoky marmalade, or both! I equally enjoyed the side of matchstick fries.My girlfriend ordered the Drive-in burger (~$16): two patties in a brioche bun, dressed with classic toppings. A very good burger but I think if you are going to Deville for a burger you should order something special. (there is a burger with cheese stuffed patties and more cheese on top!!).We did not order dessert because we had stuffed ourselves. The dessert options sounded great so we will be back for them!

Recently visited Deville Dinerbar with a group of friends. Great warm and relaxing atmosphere. Great interior decor..classy. Service also great ...warm and friendly. Food was really great.....burger meat was juicy and packed with flavors....accompanied by crisp fries....would definitely go back!

Deville is my daughter's favourite restaurant and our go to place for family celebrations.  It's an upscale diner with a funky retro feel.  The food is modern takes on diner classics.  My personal favourite is the macho salad.  Fries and burgers are excellent.  Portions are giant, bring your appetite! They have lots of fun cocktail specials and a decent wine list.  My daughter loves the milkshakes.  Service is usually prompt and friendly.  Great place to go to celebrate a birthday or other fun event.
The portion sizes are absolutely huge--making the place worth the money! I got the carbonera pasta and it was delicious with the pieces of meat and poached egg! The daily drink specials are great!!

This was my favorite place to eat on my 3 day weekend in Montreal.  the drinks were tasty and well priced. I loved the decor and ambiance.  Service was super friendly.  He even gave us recommendations on things to do in Montreal.Everything looked amazing on the menu,  We started off with the mini hot dogs and tuna tacos, both were great! I got the General Tso chicken salad which was delicious,.  My husband got the business bento box that has to much food for only $18.00 CAD.   He loved it.  It came with a soup, salad, 2 huge fried pork patties and a delicious apple fritter dessert. The bill adds up quickly after drinks and apps.  We spent about $100.00 USD.

we stopped in for a late lunch today.eventhough it was during the shift change from lunch to dinner everything was great.My Deville burger was excellent although messy.The Adult milk shake my wife ordered was also very good.I will recommend this restaurant to friends.

I went here for my birthday in February and it was SO GOOD! The mac and cheese bites were to die for and the fishbowl cocktails were bigger than my head and so so worth it. The prices were moderate but appropriate for the experience. Our waiter was kind, prompt, and hilarious. Would 100% go back and will recommend it to many!

Nice place for dinner. The French Dip was outstanding. The meatloaf was as well. Didn't particularly care for the fries. The place itself was very clean, just not the kind of atmosphere I like. Not a deal breaker, just not my thing. The prices were ok, but a little on the expensive not. The bar staff was terrific and did a real nice job.

One of my favorite places in Montreal. My second time here and it was just as good as I remembered. The only repeat dish from both visits was the coconut onion rings. Hands down some of the best onion rings I've ever had! Burgers are very generous helpings as each comes with two patties. I had the mushroom burger (their vegetarian patty) and my boyfriend had the Fat Cat. Both were A+. The fries are the small shoelace fries and perfectly crispy/salty/soft. To end our meal we opted for a boozey milkshake and god damn it was so good. Called the Kitty Kat, it consists of Bailey's, Rumchata, Kitkat and a few other things. The only regret we had was not ordering two.

This is another random lunch place that my boyfriend and I decided to try. It had decent reviews on Yelp and the price point was right up our alley after a couple nights of expensive dinners.We both ordered the burger and fries. As we were waiting for our food, I was starting to regret not ordering a salad. So many tables around us ordered salads and they looked so fresh! However, when our burgers + fries came, I was not disappointed at all. The burger was juicy and the fries were definitely the star of the dish. They're my favourite type of fries (shoestring) and they were perfectly crispy. It was so good we ditched parts of our burger just to finish the fries.I recommend this restaurant to people who are around this area and looking for reasonably priced food.

A restaurant named Deville has to have an old-school fill right? Well Deville Dinerbar definitely does.  It is reminiscent of an old 50's style diner but with a modern twist to include neon lights and all.  When we were seating at our table my wife and I were instantly talking about how the feel of the restaurant made us think of Elvis.  The look reminded us of a rock-a-billy style that was prominent back then.  The service was great, our server was quick with drinks and ensure they were never empty.  The food came out quick and was cooked the way we wanted.As for the food, I ordered a burger.  The Deville Burger to be exact.  It was a double patty burger with the Deville sauce. I figured if its named after the restaurant I couldn't go wrong.  Oh boy was I right, the burger came to the table and it lived up to the hype.  A tall oversized double patty burger that was sure to crush any hunger pains I may have.  Not only was it large, but it was delicious.  The meat was cooked very well and was just as juicy as you could ask for.  The Deville sauce was a delectable and welcome addition to the meal. The fires were fries.  Simple yes, but cooked very well and seasoned perfectly. Overall the Deville is a great spunky place for one to go if they are looking for an old school style restaurant with that modern fill.  The food is sure to please, both large in size and big in flavor.

Deville is such a cool, fun place to eat.. food is amazing and the place has such a cool atmosphere and decor.. menu is pretty extensive and everything I've ever tried from here has been delicious. Good food and good servers makes for a great meal

Last time i came to this place it was in 2012. I was surprised it was still around. This is one of the rare places that have chicken and waffles and that's the main reason I went.
